job_description:
Blockovate is looking for an experienced Full Stack Web Developer who wants to be part of a proactive, lean, versatile digital team, operating leading international brands in the investing, crypto, stocks, and trading space.

You'll have the opportunity to work with extremely talented industry enthusiasts, marketers, and directors, building and maintaining a system that directly impacts our company's revenue.

Role

Blockovate is looking for a highly motivated Full Stack Web Developer to join our team and focus their energy on our internal business system. The system is the engine that powers our business, from partnerships and commercial deals, to marketing analytics, and website & user data.

We are looking for someone with fantastic communication skills, who is always happy to help, willing to go the extra mile, and can work independently. This is an extremely varied role that requires excellent prioritisation and organisation skills.

Key accountabilities
• To understand and translate business goals and requirements from cross-functional directors into strategic technical plans and projects
• To build, maintain, and consistently upgrade our internal business system so that it meets the requirements of stakeholders
• To ensure our internal business system is suitable and compatible with all company properties and customer facing assets
• To ensure our internal business system is accompanied by clear technical documentation, processes, and know-how that can be passed on
• To maintain all web, user and internal data that flows through our systems is stored, accessible, and available in an analytics-like-system (e.g lookerstudio)
• To properly manage and organise your own roadmap, time, and deliverables via project management tool Trello
• To clearly and consistently communicate with key stakeholders regarding the status of any project or system at any given time
• To stay on top of technology budgets, keeping costs under control at all times
• To stay on top of required tools, services and subscriptions

Requirements
• 5+ years experience in a similar role
• Experienced in PHP language and Laravel framework specifically
• Experience with Postgres and Redis database systems
• Experience with Vue Js and Nuxt
• Experience developing with NodeJS
• Experience with our preferred tech stack would be considered a valuable bonus
• Experience within previous marketing companies or marketing technologies a bonus
• Experience within affiliate marketing of any kind a bonus

Tech Stack
• Inertiajs
• Node JS
• Databases - Postgres, Redis
• Vue

Personal
• High levels of energy and enthusiasm
• Hard working and proactive
• Thrives in a challenging and fast-paced environment
• Resilient and maintains a positive attitude at all times

Perks of working with us
• You'll have the opportunity to work with a talented and friendly group of people who are driven to be the best at what they do
• We offer a place for you to take ownership of your work and grow within the business
• Everyone is valued, listened to and recognised as contributing in their own way to the company's success
• We have a great work-hard play-hard culture, so expect lots of team socials!

Benefits
• Remote working policy - work in the office, at home, or a mix of both
• Working from home budgets
• Access to lovely Uncommon offices, our buzzy co-working space in Central London
• Monthly team lunches and social events
• Half-day Fridays twice a month
• 33 days holiday (inclusive of bank & public holidays) plus an additional day for every year worked
• Company pension scheme
• Life insurance coverage

We’re looking for an experienced web developer [full stack] with Wordpress, PHP, Python, java and node js programming language experienced with more than 3 years commercial work experience only.

After our initial assessment, we will ask you to do an online exam prior us engaging in the work.

No graduate or anyone with less than 3 years commercial experience please. No freelancers/no trainers etc.

Notice on closing date & interview: once the application is closed, we will conduct interviews via Zoom and those successful would be contacted within 2 weeks of that closure. Due to volumes of applications, we cannot contact everyone.
• You will need to work Monday to Friday.
• 8:30am to 6pm. 1 hour unpaid lunch.
• Office based.
• Holiday would be 28 days a year including Gov bank holidays and sickness leave.

The role with involve:
• Working on our websites and CRM applications.
• Work across all in-house products.
• Must capability to work with CMS (WordPress, Joomla, Magento).
• Must capability to work with Shopify.
• Capability to create a WordPress theme/advance plugin for marketplace.
• Expert in PHP frameworks Codeigniter.
• Capability to work with Laravel.
• Good Problem Solving skill with an eye for clean and maintainable codes.
• Proficient in PHP7, MySQL HTML/HTML5, CSS/ CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, Ajax & and modern web technologies like responsive Web Design and current UX trends.
• Sound knowledge in Object Oriented Programming(i.e. OOPs) concepts in PHP.
• Must have good exposure of RESTful API integration and Development.
• The full stack developer will work on NodeJS and React-Redux. So anyone with solid programming knowledge are welcome to apply. Should know and work in NodeJS.
• Strong background in Object Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts.
• Strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design.
• Sound knowledge of DDD, design patterns etc.
• Experience with REST/ JSON/ SOAP APIs, back-end server connectivity.

TVF Digital is an award-winning agency that creates and delivers high profile digital campaigns across a wide range of technical platforms and sectors including broadcast media, live events, film, publishing and healthcare. As part of the TVF Media group, TVF Digital has an eclectic and diverse set of clients including BBC, Ogilvy, UEFA Champions League, MasterCard, Channel 4, Accord Healthcare, and Discovery (to name a few!).

We are seeking an enthusiastic, creative Full-stack (you must be comfortable with both front and back end development) Junior Web Developer to join our expanding Digital team in our vibrant office in Central London. You'll be joining a close-knit group of first class designers, creatives, post-production specialists, and developers who thrive on creating cutting edge projects and campaigns. You will be encouraged to grow your skillset and develop your creative flair across our roster of clients and maintain existing sites as well as creating new and exciting web platforms.

The ideal candidate should possess the following:
• An excellent can-do attitude and a desire to learn and succeed.
• Good knowledge of either PHP or NodeJS.
• Experience working with javascript, HTML5 and CSS3.
• Analytical mindset with good numeracy skills.
• A top notch problem solving approach and ability to think outside the box

The following is also desirable for you to succeed across the team:
• Experience working with either SVN or git.
• Experience with a javascript framework (Angular, React, etc).
• Comfortable working with Linux web servers.
• Knowledge of Apache and Nginx - configuring virtual hosts, setting up SSL certificates, and general administration.

At TVF Digital we are focused on supporting your career progression and wellbeing. In joining our team, you will also become eligible for our range of benefits, including our pension scheme, private healthcare insurance cashback scheme, hybrid working, Cycle to Work, frequent company socials and biannual parties, gym and festival ticket discounts, and more!

All applicants must have an excellent educational background with a degree from a top university and strong technical skills.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and actively support and encourage people from a variety of backgrounds, experiences and skill sets to join us and help shape what we do. If you think you have what it takes, please apply now!

At Citymapper by Via, we’re on a mission to help make cities easier to navigate. Our app helps millions of people around the world make the best decision on how they want to travel. Whether it's on foot or by bicycle, above ground or underground, or a combination of modes, our real-time data ensures that users have the most accurate and up-to-date information available.

We're looking for an incredible Full-Stack Web Developer to help develop our products and bring the joy of the web to our other teams. If you've got strong React experience and a friendly attitude, get in touch.

What You'll Do:
• Help us develop our web application for consumers, our tooling for agencies, and our extensive suite of internal tools we use to power Citymapper
• Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design
• Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
• Write effective APIs
• Code, test, review, and ship back-end and front-end multiple times a week
• Provide your expertise to help guide us through all of the decisions that go into building great products
• Work with data scientists, analyst, developers, designers and product managers to improve our software

Who You Are:
• You should have a strong understanding of best practices of web development and impressive front-end skills (ES6, JS).
• Technologies: React, Node, Typescript, GraphQL a plus, MUI a plus and of course other better tools that we don't even know about yet (come and tell us!)
• Commercial web development experience of at least 1 year
• Experience working in cross-functional teams
• Experience working with maps and GeoJSON a plus (but you already knew that)
• Self-directed and driven
• Have the ability to articulate super-nerdy ideas to people who don't have computer science degrees
• Take pride in the work you do

Citymapper is an innovative journey planning and transportation technology company that has transformed the way that millions of users navigate their cities. Powered by real-time transport information and best-in-class technology, our app recommends routes across multiple modes of transport, including metros, buses, trams, bikes, scooters, and taxis so users find the most efficient, affordable, and convenient way to reach their destination.

In March 2023, Citymapper was acquired by Via, the leader in TransitTech. The integration of Citymapper into Via’s software platform creates a unified solution for cities, transit agencies, and riders that encourages public transit usage and reduces the need for private vehicles.

We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Citymapper by Via.

Ready to join the ride?

We are an equal opportunity employer.

employer_name: SoBold - the High Performance WordPress Agency
job_description:
SoBold is a high-performance, WordPress website design and development agency based in London. We have gone from strength to strength since our inception in 2014 and now is the time to super-charge this.

We are looking for an ambitious Front End Developer with WordPress experience to join our growing team. We work with companies of all sizes from small boutique brands, to publicly listed businesses and household names.

In this role, you will work closely with other Back End and Front End WordPress Developers and will report directly to our Technical Director. You must be confident and willing to bring innovative ideas to the table.

Key Responsibilities
• Utilising a variety of markup languages to develop pixel perfect, responsive web pages.
• Ensuring web development is optimized for smartphones.
• Building reusable code for future use.
• Optimizing web pages for maximum speed and scalability.
• Create documentation outlining processes and/or offering advice on how to go about tackling certain issues for clients and other team members.
• Developing more technically challenging functionality, including AJAX loaded content.
• Snagging and testing websites to ensure they adhere to our high standards.
• Taking the lead of front end aspects of projects where necessary.
• Assisting more junior members of the front end development team.

Key Requirements
• Exceptional understanding of HTML, SCSS, JavaScript, and jQuery.
• A minimum of 2 years experience of using PHP to render WordPress websites.
• Experience with custom post types, Gutenberg and the Advanced Custom Fields plugin.
• Very good knowledge of GIT based workflows.
• Experience with responsive and adaptive design.
• High level of understanding of SEO principles.
• Good planning and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent verbal communication skills.
• Good interpersonal skills.

Benefits
• Annual discretionary bonus
• Private Healthcare
• 25 days holiday (plus Bank Holidays)
• A hybrid working environment, with up to two days working from home per week after your probationary period.

Our hiring process

Here's a brief overview of what you can expect from the rest of our hiring process:
• We review your application and portfolio.
• A 15-minute phone call with our Technical Director so we can find out more about you and you can find out more about the business and role.
• A small WordPress related task.
• A follow-up interview with our Technical Director and Managing Director to discuss how you found the task.
• A face-to-face meeting to give you a flavour of our team and offices and so we can give you an introduction to some of our workflows and processes.
• Get an offer!

About By Association Only (BAO)

BAO is a globally award-winning Shopify Plus eCommerce agency based in the UK. We're a senior team of designers, developers and marketers that are committed to exceptional standards in eCommerce. We work explicitly with Shopify Plus merchants - generally in the fashion, cosmetics and luxury goods sectors for brands all over the world in competitive global markets.

We work in a studio where independence, autonomy and doing the right thing is at the centre of everything we do. As an agency we're on a mission to work with the worlds most ambitious eCommerce brands and we do this in an environment that is smart, open, fast-paced, fun and rewarding.

Although we're headquartered in Cambridge, we are staffed by around 70% permanently remote employees that are located all over the UK. All of our team members are full time employees.

Who we're looking for

We're searching for talented, conscientious and ambitious developers that want to work on exciting eCommerce projects for global brands. We love people that are inquisitive, enjoy problem solving and share our vision to build a global agency with a reputation for excellence in both product and service offering.

Skills / Experience

We're looking for a set of skills that are common to the majority of our projects:
• Hands-on technical experience with an e-Commerce platform - Shopify, Magento, Big Commerce etc
• A minimum of 2 years experience working on active projects
• A good understanding of JavaScript and working knowledge of one or more modern JavaScript frameworks (like Vue, or React).
• Can write well-structured semantic & accessible HTML.
• Is comfortable writing framework agnostic and performance focused JavaScript.
• Is very conscious of WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility requirements and follows progressive enhancement methodologies.
• Solid web development principles and extensive knowledge of front-end performance practices.
• Building complex interactions in a performant way, with a high degree of polish.
• Strong technology generalist with a positive, problem-solving attitude.
• Working with modern web stacks (transpilers, linters, build and CI tools, etc.)
• Solid understanding of Git and version control and working on a team of multiple developers.

Bonus Points for:
• Experience with a common back-end language or framework, preferably Ruby or Node.
• Working in an agency or creative studio environment delivering websites for a variety of clients
• Experience with databases, migration and relational data structures generally.
• Hands-on technical experience with an e-Commerce platform.
• A deep understanding of one or more specific client-side areas like animation, performance, or accessibility for example

Benefits
• Highly competitive salary DOE
• 20 days of annual leave + 8 bank holidays
• + 1 extra day per year served
• + 3/4 'BAO Thank You' Days (additional annual leave) each year around the Xmas period
• Christmas bonus scheme
• Training budget for courses or online training relevant to your role
• High-spec Apple machine
• Interesting, high-profile clients
• No micro-management culture
• Remote working or office based or a combination of the two - depending on your location
• Social events throughout the year
• Clear career progression paths and a structured employee review process

- - - - - -

Become part of our Carbon Positive workforce

Every one of our staff members are climate positive. BAO contributes a monthly payment per employee, planting trees around the world on behalf of its team. This means as an employee of BAO you'll be offsetting your entire carbon footprint, including emissions from your home, personal travel, holidays, food, hobbies and more.

NO AGENCIES PLEASE - SERIOUSLY!

Barclay Simpson have partnered with a leading consultancy and technology company specialising in Decision Engineering. We are looking for talented Front-End Web Developers to join a dynamic team. You will play a crucial role in creating exceptional user experiences by developing and implementing high-quality user interfaces for our web-based applications.

Locations - London, Cambridge or Southwest

Hybrid/Remote working

£35,000 - £50,000 depending on experience

Key Skills Required:
• SC clearance or the ability to obtain - *Essential*
• 3 years+ proven experience as a Front-End Web Developer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing your UI development skills.
• Experience interfacing with RESTful APIs.
• Familiar with cloud infrastructure and services (Azure/AWS)
• Experience/ exposure with NoSQL and Python highly desirable.

• PERMANENT ROLE* - Senior Web Developer/Software Engineer

Must Have
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a web development role
• Minimum 2 years’ experience in an Angular web development role
• Experience working with .Net

Job Title: Senior Web Developer

Reports To: Development Manager

Business: Insurance

Contract: Full Time - Permanent

Hours: 37.5

Salary: £65,000 - £75,000

Our purpose at Eurobase is to enable our partners to be more successful and we are on a mission is to be the best provider of solutions and services to our chosen markets. We want to provide the highest value to our customers through delivery of powerful technology, leading industry expertise ensuring our culture enables our people to thrive within an ethical sustainable and successful business.

We have become a recognised leader in technology to the reinsurance, commercial and captive insurance sectors as well as banks and other financial institutions. We also have a successful specialist IT recruitment business providing both contract and permanent services within the UK and Europe.

We C.A.R.E about our values, they are important in helping us achieve our cultural aspirations and are in service to our Purpose and Mission
• Collaboration & Teamwork - To achieve successful results, we must work together effectively. Share information and build relationships
• Accountability - Do what we promise, we accept responsibility for our decisions, actions, and results. We learn from our mistakes and grow stronger every time
• Respect & Inclusion - We recognise that the thoughts, feelings, and backgrounds of others are as important as our own. We will be open to learning our own bias and changing behaviours. Diversity, inclusion, and belonging are fundamental to the success of Eurobase. We aim to make a significant impact in our efforts to foster an environment where everyone can thrive.
• Excellence - To provide excellent, high-quality products, services, and interactions. We strive to always exceed expectations.

What we are focused on

We are building on 30+ years of growth and are looking for a Senior Web Developer/Software Engineer with the technical vision to guide the team towards a web first, and ultimately a cloud first approach. This is a great opportunity to make an impact and become a key technologist within the company.

Why choose Eurobase?

We have a unique heritage as a founder led business. We pride ourselves on delighting our customers and focus on building and maintaining genuine long-term partnerships, providing a consultative and collaborative approach, recognising, and responding to the needs and objectives of each customer. This approach is widely recognised and embraced by prospects and customers alike.

We are looking for people to support us on our journey and join our existing team of experienced and passionate individuals who work together towards our common purpose. This is an excellent opportunity to work for a company that has exciting growth opportunities both in the UK and internationally.

We offer hybrid working!

Overview of the role

Person Specification

Key Result Areas
• Producing detailed program specifications from either discussion directly with clients or from a functional requirements document.
• Using system specifications to develop robust, scalable applications to agreed timescales, taking any required standards.
• Integration of 3rd party services / API’s
• Ensuring that production applications are fully supported.
• Ensure completed systems are implemented in a professional manner and handed over to the correct parties, including producing any needed documentation such as operational or user guides
• Act as an expert for any systems owned by development (internal or external); including diagnosing problems and providing fixes or suggested alternatives
• Work with application architects to ensure solutions are fit for purpose and ensure sign-off on architecture is agreed
• Producing estimates (both high level and detailed) for work packages
• Communicate effectively with all parties and provide status updates where applicable
• Mentor less experienced members of the team
• Provide technical expertise
• Work with the development manager to improve processes and procedures and technology usage
• Work with CTO to improve and enhance the web program
• Conduct code reviews for quality assurance

Relevant experience
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in a web development role
• Minimum 2 years’ experience in an Angular web development role A demonstrable history of working on projects that have successfully improved the way companies deliver their software to clients
• Collaborated with 3rd party managed services to integrate with our live and development systems
• Angular.io
• Net Frameworks 3.5+
• .Net Core
• Restful API
• JQUERY / AJAX / JavaScript
• CSS / HTML
• XML / JSON
• NGRX / RxJS
• NPM
• Angular CLI
• TypeScript
• TDD (test driven development)
• NUnit and Moq
• Testing Web Frameworks such as JEST
• Code formatters / Styles such as Prettier / ESLint
• SignalR
• WCF
• Entity Framework
• DevExpress Angular Controls
• JWT Bearer Tokens
• Microsoft Developer Certification
• SASS Stylesheets
• SSIS, SSRS
• Message Queues (RabbitMQ)
• Test Automation
• Experience with cross browser testing
• Exposure / Experience in SOA
• TFS integration and usage (Source control, Life Cycle Management Tool)
• Experience with Code refactoring / analysis tools
• Containerisation
• Build and Release Pipelines
• PowerShell

Aptitude, skills and abilities
• You are used to analysing problems and working with agile development teams to quickly remediate and fix complex problems
• Exercise significant independent judgement to determine the best method for accomplishing objectives
• You have the proven ability to understand the needs and demands of delivery focused software engineering teams
• Excellent spoken and written English

job_title: Head Of Web Development in Berlin
job_description:
Join us as Head Of Web Development

Location: Berlin, Germany

Do you want to shape the future direction of our web architecture? Are you an expert in web technologies and web site design? Do you strive for elegance and simplicity in your technical work?

If so, we would like to meet you. Here is what we offer in a nutshell:
• Lots of freedom for your own ideas
• An international team of brilliant minds
• A working environment that makes this team stay and grow
• Enough time to make sure that every detail of your solution is perfect
• A flat organization
• No scheduled meetings
• Family-friendly working hours, no deadlines, no overtime
• Support for relocation
• A competitive salary from the start and a raise to EUR 130,000 annually after only one year

The role and your impact

think-cell is known as a C++ shop. But the world is not just native code. We are now looking for an excellent web developer to spear-head our pursuit of excellence on the web.
• You will be the first developer at think-cell to focus solely on web technologies.
• You will influence the future direction of our web architecture and technology stack, which is currently Bootstrap and SASS for styling our website and Statamic for static site generation.
• You will be responsible for evaluating and implementing search engine optimizations, and stay on top of new trends in that domain.
• You will interface with our backend written in C++, and will learn to make changes to it as well. Experience in middleware technologies in general or Talend specifically is a plus - if you don't have experience it would be appreciated if you'd be open to gain knowledge in this field.

Your profile

We do not require any formal education, but most of our developers have an excellent degree in computer science or a related field. We take pride in only hiring the best, and our community of developers is unlike anything you will find in other companies. They have been the best wherever they came from, and now they are all at think-cell.

Of course, excellent people should be compensated accordingly. After one year of employment, your salary will rise to EUR 130.000 per year.

You must be fluent in our company language English. We do not require German language skills, but help with language courses if you wish.

Core skills: Web Development, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Statamic, PHP

Interested?

If you are the one missing from our team then please send us your electronic application.

This is a remote position.

Job Summary

Join Momentum is seeking a talented and passionate Front-End Developer Intern to join our dynamic team. As a leading tech company specializing in innovative software solutions, we are dedicated to creating cutting-edge applications that drive progress and empower businesses around the world. This internship opportunity offers hands-on experience, mentorship, and the chance to contribute to real-world projects. If you have a strong foundation in front-end development and are eager to learn and grow, we want to hear from you!

Requirements

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with our development team to design and implement user-friendly, responsive web applications and interfaces.

Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Conduct regular testing and debugging to ensure optimal performance and user experience across multiple devices and browsers.

Participate in code reviews to provide and receive constructive feedback.

Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies to contribute to continuous improvement and innovation.

Work closely with designers, product managers, and other stakeholders to bring ideas to life and deliver high-quality solutions.

Requirements:
• Good knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
• Experience with modern front-end frameworks such as React, Next.js Angular, or Vue.js.
• Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.
• Solid understanding of responsive design principles and mobile-first development.
• Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as SASS or LESS.
• Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
• Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

Benefits

Benefits:
• Hands-on experience working on real-world projects in a supportive and collaborative environment.
• Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals in the field.
• Opportunity to expand your skills and knowledge in front-end development.
• Flexible work hours and the possibility of remote work.
• Performance-based rewards and compensation.

How to Apply:

To apply for the Front-End Developer Intern position at Join Momentum, please submit your resume, cover letter, and a link to your portfolio or relevant projects to [email address]. In your cover letter, please include a brief description of your interest in front-end development and what you hope to gain from this internship.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Join Momentum is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
